repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits

summary.p: The volume 1 of a 2-volume Naṉṉūl. The volume 2 is BnF Indien 180.

The manuscript contains the Ciṟuppapāyiram, Potuppāyiram and Eḻuttatikāram of the Naṉṉūl with the commentary by Caṅkaranamaccivāyar, styled Naṉṉūluraipāṭam Caṅkaranamacivāyam in the margin titles and published under the title Viruttiyurai as edited by Āṟumukanāvalaravar, 1860.
Description by Victor D'Avella based on the examination of the original manuscript.

msItem.title: Naṉṉūl Eḻuttatikāram with the commentary of Caṅkaranamaccivāyar (Viruttiyurai)
msItem.author: Pavaṇanti, Caṅkaranamaccivāyar

finalRubric.term: Chapter end titles are found. Generally the leaf remainder of the leaf is left empty after the end of a section (iyal). See below.

extent.measure: {1} + {1} + 166 (U1 + U2 + U3). ― There are two unnumbered leaves at the beginning and one blank numbered leaf at the end.

supportDesc.foliation: 2 initial leaves are unnumbered thereafter all leaves are numbered on the recto, middle left margin in Tamil numerals ending with 166. Arabic numerals are written below the Tamil numerals on all but the last leaf.

collation.desc: 1 folio = Naṉṉūl: Title Page (French). Verso blank. No foliation. 410 x 35 mm.
1 folio = Naṉṉūl: Invocation (4 satellite stanzas). Verso blank. No foliation. 410 x 35 mm.
166 folios = Naṉṉūl: Title Page. Tamil foliation 1-166. Parallel Arabic foliation 1-166. f166 blank recto verso. 410 x 35 mm.

supportDesc.condition: The leaves are in impeccable condition.

layoutDesc.layout: Scriptio continua throughout with section titles in the margin as well as the initial syllables of verses/cūttirams. On the second unnumbered leaf four verses are written in three columns divided by the string holes. The cūttirams are numbered in the body of the text at the end of the commentary. An equals sign (=) surrounds the number.

handNote.desc: Fairly regular, neat hand, probably Ducler's scribe. Ducler's scribe.

additions.desc:
On the recto of a slip of paper (190 x 85 mm) is written in ink the following title in cursive script:
mr Ducler No 30
intitulé Nannoule, ou grammaire, Tamoul
2ème Partie
Solliyal, ou Etymologie, (ouvrage anonyme)
contenant 203 feuilles. This is incorrect and belongs to the second part of the manuscript containing the second chapter of the Naṉṉūl, the Collatikāram, BnF Indien 180. The number is that found in the catalogue of Velanguani Arokium (1845) for this second part. The sheets of paper have been interverted between the 2 volumes of this 2-volume manuscript.
BnF current shelfmark sticker, covering an older sticker: INDIEN 179 (front cover, recto).

A series of 4 satellite stanzas are written on the recto of the second unnumbered leaf in three columns divided by the string holes (f[1]r). Three of these are well-know verses. The verses have been discussed and translated in D'Avella 2020. The second verse is the opening to the Kuṟuntokai. See below.
Chapter/section headings are given in the margin. See below.

binding.p: Original light brown wooden cover boards and string. 410 x 30 mm. 165 mm between stringholes.

origin.origDate: No internal date. Dated to circa 1830 by Vinson (1868) and to 1830 by Cabaton (1912), on unstated grounds (presumably Ducler's provenance). By Ducler's scribe, working around 1830. Probably not before 1828 (date of the earliest internally dated Ducler's manuscript). Not later than its first mention (Burnouf 1832). ― The date (1830) given in Cabaton's catalogue (p. 30) is likely approximate, but as the manuscript belongs to the collection of Ducler, it must have been produced around this time.

provenance.p: Copied for Philippe Ducler by an unnamed copyist in Karaikal Jail. See Burnouf (1832). ― One of the manuscripts Ducler had copied while working in Karaikal.

acquisition.p: Acquired, July 22nd, 1833, from Philippe Ducler. See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 1 = Acquisitions: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1833-1848, no. 71.

listBibl.bibl: Naṉṉūl. 1860 (Irauttiri yr. Āvaṇi m.). Naṉṉūl Viruttiyurai of Pavaṇanti. Ed. Āṟumukanāvalar. 3rd printing. Ceṉṉapaṭṭaṇam (Chennai): Vittiyānupālaṉayantiracālai.

Burnouf, Eugène. 1832. Rapport fait au Conseil, dans la séance du 2 juillet 1832, sur les collections de manuscrits et de dessins rapportées de l’Inde par M. Ducler, administrateur de Carical, membre de la Société asiatique. Journal asiatique 10: 84-91. — See p. 87, n0. 5: 5. Nannoule, ou grammaire malabare, 1re partie, orthographe; 166 feuilles.
Cabaton, Antoine. 1912. Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See p. 57, nos. 179-180.

D'Avella, Victor B. 2020. Orbiting Material in Tamil Grammatical Texts, in Colophons, Prefaces, Satellite Stanzas edited by Eva Wilden and Suganya Anandakichenin, pp. 223-280. Hamburg: Department of Indian and Tibetan Studies, Universität Hamburg (Indian and Tibetan Studies 10).
Velanguani Arokium [Vēḷāṅkaṇṇi Ārōkkiyam]. 1845. Catalogue des manuscrits tamouls de la Bibliothèque royale. BnF NAF 5443. — See p. 17, no. 29.
Vinson, Julien & Feer, Léon & s.n. 1866-. Catalogue des manuscrits tamoul et télinga. Manuscript, BnF Indien 577. — See f. 44r, nos. 179, 180.

Vinson, Julien. 1868. Manuscrits tamouls. Proofreadings of the catalogue for Tamoul 1-204 (old shelfmark). Printed by the atelier oriental de l’Imprimerie nationale. BnF “4-IMPROR-77 (B)”. — See p. 44, nos. 179, 180. — The same proofreadings with black ink handwritten corrections are found in Vinson et al. (1866-, f1-f49).

encodingDesc.p: The Tamil text has been given twice. Once in Tamil script approximating as closely as possible the text as it appears in the manuscript. The transliterated text, however, is interpretative in that it follows how the text would be printed in a modern edition with puḷḷis long ē/ō, etc.

revisionDesc.change: Updated to TST encoding conventions by Emmanuel FRANCIS. Updated history, bibliography. Revised by Emmanuel FRANCIS. Version 1, May 2022.
Revised and updated by Emmanuel FRANCIS.

ab.seg:
Centred on the recto of the first unnumbered leaf is incised and inked the following title in cursive script as is typical of manuscripts in the Ducler collection
Grammaire Malabare
Orthographie.

body.ab:
ஹரி ஒம
நனறாக
குருவாழக
நனனூலு
ரைபாடம
சஙகாநம
சிவாயம
எணணியவெணணியவெ
யதுபகணணுதறபவளமா
லவரைபயநதகவளயா
னையினகழலபணிவொரெ
தாமரைபுரையுஙகாமாசெவடி
பவளததனனமெனிததிகழொளி
குனறியெயககுமுடுககைககுனறி
னெஞசுபகவெறிநதசெஞசுடாநெடுவெற
செவலஙகொடியொனகாபப
வெமவைகலெயதினறாலுலகெ
தவளததாமரைததாதாாகொயில
வளைபபொறறுதுமருநதமிழகுறி
ததெ ~
சநதனபபொதியததடவரைசசெ
நதமிழபபாமாசாரியனனுபதஙகள
சிாமெறகொளளுதுநதிகழதாற
பொருடடெ

lg.l: p pavaḷatt' aṉṉa mēṉit tikaḻ Oḷi
ṉeñcu paka veṟinta ceñ cuṭar neṭu vēṟ

app.note: This verse is the opening to the Kuṟuntokai.

lg.l:
vaḷaip pōṟṟutum Arun tamiḻ kuṟi
ttē ~

வாசைமுனிவிகநதுயாநத வறபுதமூறதிதனனலாதருதனமையின ~
= எனபது = பாயிரம ~
= இமமூனறுமுரைபபாயிரம சிறபபுபபாயிரமுறறும =

ஐநதாவ

~ சிறுபானமைவருமெனவுஙகொளக ~ இனறுமிவவைரைநதியலுளளு மவகுதது
ரையாதனவறறையெலலாமிடாபபடாதிதுவெ - நிலனாகவகுததுரைததுககொளக = ௰௮ = ஐநதாவதுருபுபுண
